data.title: Meh
data.text: I found this pizza to be just average. Ordered delivery to my hotel room on a Friday night and it took 1.5 hours to receive. Not really worth the wait. Expected more after reading the reviews.

data.title: Good Pizza Found in Oregon
data.text: Stopped in here on our way of town during a recent vacation. Great location downtown. Offers some outdoor seating which was great as we had our sons dogs with us. Very crowded place. Very cramped inside. Good pizza and great local beers to have with lunch. Just what we needed but nothing over the top.

data.title: Very Good Pizza!
data.text: Pizza Mondo was a clear favorite with the locals when we asked for a good pizza and that can be delivered.  They were right real good pizza and was delivered to our VRBO.  We ordered the large combination and that is one big pie and so very good. Medium crust thickness with a large variety of toppings.  Needless to say, we had left overs for breakfast. Prices might be a tad high, but hey you are in Bend.

data.title: fast and jummy
data.text: Good pizza place either to stay or to go, not always all the selection if you just want a slice, but it is so fast.

data.title: Great Pizza
data.text: We ordered a Rita Pizza for take out to take back to our rental apartment - Great Pizza!! So good that we ate the leftovers for breakfast the next day which is something we have not done in a long, long time.

data.title: Decent pizza, but far from the best.
data.text: Friendly people. Pizza was decent. Thickish sort of chewy crust. Flavours were great. Plenty of cheese. Nothing to object to, but nothing to stand out either. However, if Mondo was located in PDX, I would not get it again. I would try somewhere else in Bend before getting it again.

data.title: Best pizza in town.
data.text: Get your order in early and savor the taste later.  The pizzas are most creative and can be custom made to your tastes.  The place is small and the pizzas large.  Very, very good.

data.title: Best Pizza in Bend
data.text: We've been coming here forever and, in my opinion, it's the bests pizza in Bend.  It's a little crowded in here so if you value elbow room or have a large party you might want to look elsewhere or get your pizza to go.

data.title: Iconic Bend pizza company with slices available all the time!
data.text: In downtown Bend, Pizza Mondo is the place for pizza.  Casual, kid-friendly, local pizzeria has slices available at all times, salads, garlic knots, etc.  Sidewalk tables, too.  Delicious!

data.title: Abso-freakin-lutely Delicious!
data.text: Pizza Mondo makes one hell of a spectacular pie! Last week while staying in Bend, we tried the Little Italy, which is one amazing pepperoni loaded pizza. What sets one pizza joint apart from another comes down to the crust, sauce, and cheese. The sauce was absolutely delicious, not too sweet and not too sharp. The crust had an absolutely wonderful flavor and would've been good all by itself! The kicker was the cheese. I'm not sure where they get their mozzarella from, but it was so wonderfully flavorful, which is quite a change from most pizza places. Do yourself a favor if you haven't already eaten at Pizza Mondo and do so now! (my mouth is even watering as I write this, lol.)

data.title: What is the hype?
data.text: Really this is the best pizza in Bend?  This is extremely mediocre pizza.  When it says garlic, it means entire cloves.  The crust is weak and without flavor.  And it is without service.  Order at the counter.  Bend, you deserve better.

data.title: Fantastic pizza
data.text: After several days in bend we wanted something delivered. The hostel staff said that we must try Pizza Mondo. Wow! We got a large pepperoni. The crust was perfect, the sauce was exceptional and the cheese was out of this world. It made me question my favorite pizza place at home. The only downside was the hour wait for delivery, but it was a Saturday night and everyone else knows about their pizza.

data.title: Great place!
data.text: Enjoyed a pizza and salad after a fun day traveling to Florence for Dune Buggy rides! Nice indoor or outdoor seating. Fun shops close by while you wait for seating or food.

data.title: Delicious pizza!!
data.text: I asked a local where the best pizza in bend was, and he directed us to Pizza Mondo.  Lots of different options available for every taste.  The pizza we got was delicious, the sauce was just right, the toppings were fresh, and the service was good.  Wouldn't recommend this location for large parties, but you can call ahead and pick up a pizza or stop by and get a slice or two to go.  Don't let the small size deter you from getting some really great pizza!

data.title: Good lunch option
data.text: Fresh, tasty affordable pizza. Lunch special: one slice (generous size) choice of pizza, included side salad & soda- right size, right price, good location.

data.title: Super yum!
data.text: I googled best pizza in Bend, Oregon and this place came up.  We also asked the hotel front desk, he also recommended them and gave us a menu.  We ordered a large cheese pizza with half pepperoni, meatball, sausage, green pepper and onion.  Also got an order of mozzarella cheese bread and a large salad.  Pizza was amazing!  Pieces are very large so if you have small kids you may want it double cut.  We were in a hotel so it was very nice they gave us plates, silverware, packets of crushed red pepper and Parmesan cheese.  The bread was excellent and the sauce was hot when it arrived.  Salad was very good with real shaved Parmesan, and the vinaigrette dressing was way yummy!  Would totally recommend!  Bummed we don't have one back home.

data.title: Thin crust, not very flavorful, but not going to break the bank and they deliver.
data.text: Ordered a pizza with spinach, fresh garlic, feta, and red sauce. If you didn't know what was supposed to be on the pizza, you would think it was nothing but crust, sauce, and something with the consistency of melted cheese. Next time I'll try someplace else.

data.title: Great value!
data.text: Dropped in for lunch while on a business trip to Bend. Had limited time for lunch so was glad this place had take out. The restaurant was packed and because it is so small it was really hard to maneuver in. Line was a little slow, but the staff was hustling the best they could since the line was out the door. We had lunch special, slice and salad with drink. Only $6!  Pizza was tasty and loved the smoky flavor of the thin crust. Salad was unimpressive. Great for a quick bite on the run.

data.title: Excellent!
data.text: We ordered the Piggy pizza to go and it was excellent! The service was great, fast and the food was great! Minimal seating in the restaurant (about 6-7 tables) so I think most people must take it to go. Large menu with lots of creative pizzas to choose from.

data.title: Tasty and a bargain-2 kinds of veggie pizza
data.text: They offer a great bargain at lunch-a slice, side salad and a drink for less than $6. Not my favorite pizza (I'm from NYC so think the best pizza is there) but quite tasty, would eat there again.
